page.title: 05ACCOMMODATION: QUINTON
page.content: The villages of Upper and Lower Quinton each comprise mixtures of types of house,{mainly council and {army owned. One private and one council home cater specially for the{elderly. There is some new{development}in and around the village. There are new, {detached}houses in the older parts, near the church, and also further up the slopes of Meon Hill. There are a number of{modernisations of period properties in both parts of the village. For many, the view of Meon Hill is a bonus. The army also has recently been modernising quarters. This is especially important in view of the absence of a mains gas supply to the village.Many have to use oil and electricity to heat, so{energy {conservation}is of major importance.
